The Defense Department will reduce its strategic nuclear force to 300 Minuteman III missiles by 2004. Production of Trident II missiles will be terminated, and eight Trident I submarines will be retired. Theater missile defense programs will also be reduced. SEC. 103. Reduction in theater missile defense programs includes terminating Navy sea-based area system, Army MEADS, Air Force airborne laser system, and Space and Missile Tracking System. Prohibition on funding for Arrow missile development for Israel after fiscal year 1998. SEC. 104. Termination of Marine Corps V-22 Osprey aircraft program. SEC. 104. Termination of Marine Corps V-22 Osprey aircraft program. No funds may be appropriated for the Marine Corps V-22 Osprey aircraft program after fiscal year 1998. SEC. 105. Retirement of excess KC-135 tankers. The Secretary of Defense shall retire 20 Air Force KC-135E aircraft annually from 1999 to 2003. SEC. 106. Assignment of wartime function to military personnel in training or transit. Members of the Armed Forces in transit or undergoing military training shall be assigned to a unit. SEC. 107. Recovery of full cost of military exports. The Arms Export Control Act is amended to include a charge for nonrecurring costs in commercial export sales of major defense equipment. The charge is comparable to government-to-government sales charges and does not apply to equipment paid for from specific funds under the Foreign Assistance Act. The Arms Export Control Act is amended to include a charge for nonrecurring costs in commercial export sales of major defense equipment. This charge does not apply to equipment paid for from specific funds under the Foreign Assistance Act. The effective date for this amendment is for contracts entered into after the enactment of this Act. Additionally, certain administrative expenses in connection with Foreign Military Sales are subject to recovery under the Act. TITLE II--OTHER DISCRETIONARY ACCOUNTS

SEC. 201. TERMINATION OF SPACE STATION PROGRAM.

The Administrator of NASA will end US participation in the International Space Station program, with $700,000,000 allocated for termination costs in fiscal year 1999.

SEC. 202. ELIMINATION OF LOAN SUBSIDIES UNDER THE RURAL ELECTRIFICATION ACT OF 1936.

Title I of the Rural Electrification Act of 1936 is amended to include an interest rate provision for loans and advances. ``SEC. 19. INTEREST RATE ON LOANS AND ADVANCES UNDER THIS ACT.

The interest rate on loans and advances under this Act will be based on the Treasury's yield on comparable maturity obligations.

``SEC. 20. LOAN ORIGINATION FEES. The Secretary and Governor of the telephone bank will charge a loan origination fee from borrowers to cover default costs. Amendments are made to adjust interest rates in the Act. Amendments are made to adjust interest rates in the Act by replacing specific percentages with rates determined pursuant to section 19. Amendments to the Act adjust interest rates by replacing specific percentages with rates determined pursuant to section 19. Amendments to the Act adjust interest rates by replacing specific percentages with rates determined pursuant to section 19. Sections 306C and 310 of the Act are amended to reflect these changes. Amendments to the Act involve changes to various sections, including adjusting interest rates and redesignating paragraphs. Section 408(e) is also modified by removing certain sentences. SEC. 203 amends the National Forest Management Act of 1976 to eliminate below-cost timber sales from National Forest System lands. The National Forest Management Act of 1976 was amended by SEC. 203 to eliminate below-cost timber sales from National Forest System lands. On and after October 1, 2003, the Secretary of Agriculture must ensure that the estimated cash returns from timber sales on National Forest System lands exceed the costs incurred by the Federal Government. This includes assigning specific costs to each timber sale, such as expenses for sale preparation and harvest administration. The Federal Government will allocate costs related to timber resource planning, silvicultural examination, road construction, reforestation, and administrative expenses for the timber harvest program on National Forest System lands. The Secretary will ensure that costs incurred exceed the returns from timber sales. The Secretary will allocate costs for timber resource planning, silvicultural examination, road construction, reforestation, and administrative expenses for the timber harvest program on National Forest System lands. To eliminate below-cost timber sales, the Secretary will progressively reduce the number and size of such sales in fiscal years 1999 and 2000, and further decrease them in fiscal year 2001. In fiscal years 2002 and 2003, below-cost timber sales on National Forest System lands are limited to 50% of the sales in fiscal year 2001. Below-cost timber sale refers to a sale where the Federal Government's costs exceed the cash returns to the United States Treasury. SEC. 204. Repeals the Foreign Market Development Cooperator Program.
SEC. 205. Repeals the Cochran Fellowship Program.
SEC. 206. Prohibits NASA Administrator from funding certain aviation programs.
SEC. 207. Repeals the Appalachian Regional Development Act of 1965.
SEC. 208. Eliminates federal funding for TVA. SEC. 208. Elimination of federal funding for TVA after September 30, 1998. Market Based Rates: Federal Power Marketing Administrations are required to establish the rate for the sale of electric power through competitive bidding without providing discounts or special rates to purchasers. No public body, cooperative, or Federal agency is eligible for such special rates. The Federal Energy Regulatory Commission will not approve or confirm any rate for the sale of electric power established under this subsection. The termination of the Residential Exchange Program does not apply to contracts entered into after October 1, 1998. After October 1, 1998, no Federal Power Marketing Administration can enter into power marketing contracts exceeding 5 years in duration. SEC. 302. ELIMINATION OF MARKET ACCESS PROGRAM. Repeals Section 203 of the Agricultural Trade Act of 1978. SEC. 303. INCREASE IN ASSESSMENTS UNDER TOBACCO PRICE SUPPORT PROGRAM. Increases assessment rates under the Agricultural Act of 1949. SEC. 304. PAYMENT OF IN-SCHOOL INTEREST BY STUDENT LOAN BORROWERS. SEC. 304. Payment of in-school interest by student loan borrowers. Amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to specify that for loans made after October 1, 1998, interest accrual or payment by the borrower begins at the start of the 6-month period described in the clause. Amendment to title 38, United States Code, increases copayment from $2 to $5 and extends copayment requirement deadline to September 30, 2003.
